org.opendaylight.controller.connectionmanager

Interface IConnectionManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnectionManager

    public interface IConnectionManager
    Connection Manager provides south-bound connectivity services. The APIs are currently focused towards Active-Active Clustering support wherein the node can connect to any of the Active Controller in the Cluster. This component can also host the necessary logic for south-bound connectivity when partial cluster is identified during Partition scenarios. This (and its corresponding implementation) component can also be enhanced further for more fancy algorithms/criteria for connection acceptance.

    • Method Detail

      • getActiveScheme

        ConnectionMgmtScheme getActiveScheme()
        This method returns Connectivity Algorithm (Scheme) that is currently being used.
        Returns:
        ConnectionMgmtScheme Enum that represents the active scheme.

      • getNodes

        java.util.Set<Node> getNodes(java.net.InetAddress controller)
        Method that will retrieve and return a Set of Nodes that is currently connected to the given controller.
        Parameters:
        controller - InetAddress of the Controller that is currently connected to a set of Nodes.
        Returns:
        Set Set of Nodes connected to a controller.

      • getLocalNodes

        java.util.Set<Node> getLocalNodes()
        Method that will retrieve and return a Set of Nodes that is currently connected to the controller on which this method is executed.
        Returns:
        Set Set of Nodes connected to this controller.

      • isLocal

        boolean isLocal(Node node)
        Deprecated. Use getLocalityStatus(Node node) instead. Method to test if a node is local to a controller.
        Parameters:
        node - The node for which the locality is being tested
        Returns:
        true if node is local to this controller.
        false if either node is not connected to this controller or not connected to any other controllers in the cluster.

      • getLocalityStatus

        ConnectionLocality getLocalityStatus(Node node)
        getLocalityStatus provides the tri-state connectivity status as opposed to the binary status returned by isLocal. ConnectionLocality enum that is returned by this method also includes the case of a Node not connected to any of the controllers in the cluster.
        Parameters:
        node - The node for which the locality is being verified
        Returns:
        ConnectionLocality

      • disconnect

        Status disconnect(Node node)
        Disconnect a Node from the controller.
        Returns:
        Status of the disconnect Operation.

      • connect

        Node connect(java.lang.String connectionIdentifier,
           java.util.Map<ConnectionConstants,java.lang.String> params)
        Connect to a node
        Parameters:
        connectionIdentifier - identifier with which the application would refer to a given connection.
        params - Connection Params in Map format. This is entirely handled by the south-bound plugins and is an opaque value for SAL or Connection Manager. Typical values keyed inside this params are Management IP-Address, Username, Password, Security Keys, etc...
        Returns:
        Node Node connected to.

      • connect

        Node connect(java.lang.String type,
           java.lang.String connectionIdentifier,
           java.util.Map<ConnectionConstants,java.lang.String> params)
        Connect to a node
        Parameters:
        type - Type of the node representing NodeIDType.
        connectionIdentifier - identifier with which the application would refer to a given connection.
        params - Connection Params in Map format. This is entirely handled by the south-bound plugins and is an opaque value for SAL or Connection Manager. Typical values keyed inside this params are Management IP-Address, Username, Password, Security Keys, etc...
        Returns:
        Status of the Connect Operation.

      • getControllers

        Retrieve list of cluster-members to which Node is connected to
        Parameters:
        node - Node for which cluster-members to be retrieved
        Returns:
        Set List of cluster-member addresses to which the node is connected
